meanings.definition: Baroques (noun): a style of European architecture, music, and art of the 17th and 18th centuries characterized by ornate detail and exaggerated motion.
meanings.sent1: The museum displayed beautiful baroques from the 17th century.
meanings.sent2: She studied the baroques in her art history class.
meanings.sent3: The baroques in the painting seemed to dance with life.
meanings.sent4: The baroques of the cathedral reached towards the sky like frozen music notes.
meanings.sent5: The intricate baroques in the sculpture mesmerized the visitors.

meanings.definition: Baroques (adjective): relating to or characteristic of the Baroque style.
meanings.sent1: The artist created a baroques masterpiece that impressed everyone.
meanings.sent2: Her dress had a baroques design that stood out at the party.
meanings.sent3: The baroques decorations in the room added a touch of elegance.
meanings.sent4: His baroques personality shone through in his flamboyant gestures.
meanings.sent5: The baroques architecture of the building was a sight to behold.
